page.title: 01Beacon Hill Morpeth
page.content: Beacon Hill, once a vantage point is now covered with deciduous trees. Here ambushes were prepared and in 1586 Robert Clavering was killed while travelling with brother, the Sherif. The stump of a memorial cross still stands nr Stanton House. The area has scattered farms, the fields divided by hedges, Drainage has improved the land-pasture for sheep and cattle,with a milking herd at Whinney Hill. Once there was mining and quarrying, but trees cover the sites. Altogether the area presents a pleasant rural landscape with distant views to the hills, th urban complex and the sea. Devils Causeway, a Roman road from Carbridge to Berwick, crosses the area and ws much used before enclosures took place. It is plainly visible over Todburn Moor.
